May 29, 19SI
To Bob Underwood and Ed Burrows:
As I believe you know, Robert hfcis of KOAC, Corvallis, will be
here in Washington to work on KAEB programming from September 1
to the end of the academic year (or far a full year. I'm not sure.)
WASHINGTON REPORT will continue without interruption with John
Lewis handling it at least until September 1, After thattthe situa¬
tion might be reexamined.
SPECIALS will continue to flow from Washington, Betty Mclivane
will handle this.
A final observation about specials: 1 think the injection of this
kind of immediate. Important report by a major figure speaking
meaningfully on a major them® is the best single way to give net¬
work programming a sens© of vitality. It is every NAEV station
sitting on top of significant national international affairs. It is
every NAEB station reporting from the nation's capital whenever
there is something to report.
This is to suggest that in addition to, and aside from, SPECIAL OF
TBE WEEK, really significant specials from Washington (OR else-
wherekbe distributed in such length as will do the material, rather
than the schedule, the most good.
I think our stations should be prepared to interrupt or re-arrange
their scheduling if there is a truly revealing repeat, or series of
repots, which, as a coherent unit, will run longer than a weekly
half hour.
